item.title: Loose manhole cover at the junction of Fairfield Avenue and Leckhampton Road, 16th July
item.description:
The manhole cover on Leckhampton Road and Fairfield Road junction is making a loud clanking sound whenever anything drives over it (which is very often!). The area has only just been resurfaced which is worrying.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two Voi e-bikes dumped in Hatherley Brook under Robert Burns Avenue bridge, 15th July
item.description:
To looks like two Voi bikes have been thrown off the Robert Burns Avenue bridge into Hatherly Brook and are currently lying on the bank of the brook.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Robert Burns Avenue, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on left hand side, towards Hucclecote, on the camber, just after the crown of the hill., 15th July
item.description:
Pothole on left hand side, towards Hucclecote, on the camber, just after the crown of the hill. There is a case logged here referring to "near BS Honey", so this might be the same one, but it's very much on the slant of the camber on the left. Could it be checked and ideally filled please ? Thankyou !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: ADE63 - stile completely overgrown, 15th July
item.description:
Where ADE63 meets the farm track (North-West side) the stile is virtually impossible to see and is completely overgrown and impassable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wick Lane, Deerhurst, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road surface is dangerous, 15th July
item.description:
Photo of this report ///pacemaker.trader.classmate Coming down Cleeve Hill on the B4362, kits before the last lay-by before Postlip, have added photo from google earth to show the spot but the road surface is sinking into the road, the whole area has been resurfaced and worked on before but its deteriorating rapidly. I see someone reported a pothole in this area previously and I didn’t report its last time because of this buts its worsened since i last went that way, its more than a pothole. It’s a real hazard, it’s on a bend and you don’t notice it until you are going through it. It’s a series of bumps and dips. There is a sign along the road but if it’s for this then it’s too far away. This needs action immediately, even if that’s just better signage before someone looses control of a vehicle or a cyclist comes of a bike. Whatever you filled it did before has not resolved this issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: [Portable loo] left Behind!!!, 15th July
item.description:
The [portable loo] has been left on the Island opposite a residents house for the last week. If it belongs to the workmen who were working in Butts Lane please arrange for it to be collected asap. If it belongs to the builders working on No 12A it would be nice to have it moved asap from public land. Residents would appreciate the long grass is cut to restore a sense of pride in the area, as it is looking a mess. Thanks 🙏
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bushcombe Close, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Traffic light on A40 towards Cheltenham facing wrong way resulting in confusion for bourton road traffic, 15th July
item.description:
Lights at andoversford village on the A40 have twisted from facing traffic travelling towards Cheltenham to face traffic coming from bourton direction. Not sure how long this has been an issue. What three words: molars.cats.whirlpool
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Andoversford Bypass, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Traffic light head is facing wrong direction
